overview:
Joe Francis is the creator and founder of Girls Gone Wild, an American entertainment media brand established in 1997.

Recognized for his early successes in direct-response marketing and late night infomercials, Joe made millions by age 24 with the release of Banned from Television, a direct-to-video film. He then developed and expanded the Girls Gone Wild franchise, which has grown to include over 83 film titles, a periodical GGW magazine, and television series featured on HDNet.

While Joe Francis is known as an entrepreneur, he is also involved in numerous charity works and community projects. To support Red Cross efforts in New Orleans after Hurricane Katrina, his company donated 100% of gross sales from Mardi Gras related media purchases to aid recovery victims. Joe Francis and Girls Gone Wild also support charities such as the Lili Claire Foundation, Direct Relief International, and the Elizabeth Glaser Pediatric AIDS Foundation.
